In the usa there's parts where people are openly nerdy, but other parts where people are too afraid to admit they're nerds; however in general the usa is pretty geeky and the only reason why geeks haven't completely taken over yet is because of the stigma.

topics.body:
"@EHAN":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559da6f46368725cce000418#post_559da6f46368725cce000418
It's cause of the social stigma that political interest groups are keeping alive for political agenda.

The estimated total number of gamers in the usa is 200million, and I'm NOT talking about phone games cause pc games + consoles trump phone games by fucking miles.

If you add up all the geeky stuff in the usa we're talking about hundreds of billions of dollars.  Why haven't geeks taken over yet?  Cause look at the past fucking year; political groups will do fucking anything to prevent the usa from changing in ways they don't want from physically attacking people with knives to bomb threats to fucking anything.

When you get down to it anti-geeks are way worse than geeks will ever be, cause when was the last time you heard say a weaboo try to stab someone cause they're angry that the usa isn't how they want?


Tl:dr; why isn't the usa openly geeky even though geek culture in the usa is worth hundreds of billions of dollars?
Anti-geeks have been known to try to stab people.
